text: The 1953–54 FAW Welsh Cup is the 67th season of the annual knockout tournament for competitive football teams in Wales. ==Key== League name pointed after clubs name. *FL D1 - Football League First Division *FL D3N - Football League Third Division North *FL D3S - Football League Third Division South *SFL - Southern Football League *WLN - Welsh League North ==Fifth round== Eight winners from the Fourth round and ten new clubs. Ebbw Vale & Cwn get a bye. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !width=50|Tie no !width=250|Home !width=50|Score !width=250|Away |- |1||Chester (FL D3N)||6–1||Brymbo Steelworks |} ==Sixth round== Three winners from the Fifth round plus Ebbw Vale & Cwn. Six clubs get a bye to the Seventh round. ==Seventh round== Two winners from the Sixth round, plus six clubs who get a bye in the previous round. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !width=50|Tie no !width=250|Home !width=50|Score !width=250|Away |- |1||Chester (FL D3N)||1–0||Wrexham (FL D3N) |} ==Semifinal== Flint Town United and Cardiff City played at Wrexham, Chester and Newport County played at Cardiff, replay at Wrexham. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !width=50|Tie no !width=250|Home !width=50|Score !width=250|Away |- |1||Flint Town United (WLN)||2–1||Cardiff City (FL D1) |- |2||Chester (FL D3N)||2–2||Newport County (FL D3S) |- |replay||Chester (FL D3N)||2–0||Newport County (FL D3S)'' |} ==Final== Final were held at Wrexham. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !width=50|Tie no !width=250|Home !width=50|Score !width=250|Away |- |1||Flint Town United (WLN)||2–0||Chester (FL D3N) |} ==External links== *The FAW Welsh Cup 1953-54 Wales Cup
title: 1953–54 Welsh Cup
